page.title: 05SOUTH CERNEY LEISURE (1)
page.content: South Cerney Water Park is an area of 22 square miles designated for leisure and recreation. The lakes are used mainly for wind- surfing, fishing and jet- skiing. In the Park there is an Information Bureau, toilets and other visitor facilities. The Cotswold Caravan Park has caravans with showers and flush toilets, and tents can be pitched at Â£17.50 per week. There is a central dining room, which also has a bar. At night there are discos for children. One of the old gravel pits inside the Water Park has been set aside as a bird sanctuary and is of considerable interest to visiting ornithologists. The Glos. County Council owns one of the pits, which is used to teach children sailing, canoeing and wind- surfing.
